Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored 131* off 121 balls, completing a record World Cup chase
Abdullah Shafique scored a career-best 113, partnering with Rizwan to turn the tables on Sri Lanka
Pakistan won by 6 wickets with 10 balls remaining, chasing 345
Pre-Game Insights: Shanaka praised Kusal Mendis' form and Sadeera Samarawickrama's recent performances
Babar Azam emphasized the importance of the middle order stepping up
Pakistan's fast bowlers finished well, putting pressure on Sri Lanka
Post-Match Reflections: Rizwan expressed pride in the team's performance and the dressing room's belief
Shanaka acknowledged Sri Lanka's efforts but criticized the extras and missed chances
Babar praised Rizwan's innings and the partnership with Shafique
Shanaka suggested revisiting bowling plans and encouraging the bowlers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka dropped Fakhar Zaman after one game, raising concerns in the dressing room
Pathirana conceded 5 wides in the last 10 overs, drawing criticism
Pakistan won back-to-back games, while Sri Lanka suffered their second consecutive defeat in the tournament
